entry.title: Configuring Ubuntu Server 14.04 LTS
entry.content:
Objective: Install and configure

*   SSH Server
*   Java JDK
  1. Install and configure SSH $ sudo apt-get install openssh-server

Setup SSH certificate scp ~/.ssh/id_rsa.pub <username>@<host>:~/.ssh/authorized_keys

  1. Install and configure Java JDK

``` $ sudo apt-get install openjdk-7-jdk

$ java -version java version “1.7.0_51” OpenJDK Runtime Environment (IcedTea 2.4.6) (7u51-2.4.6-1ubuntu4) OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM (build 24.51-b03, mixed mode) ```

entry.title: Installing Ubuntu Server 14.04 LTS
entry.content:
There is nothing fancy by installing new OS. It’s dead simple to install Ubuntu server for learning purpose.

  1. First, go to here to download ubuntu-14.04-server-amd64.iso file.
  2. Second, mount iso file to Virtual Box/Parallel Desktop and install OS from there.
  3. Third, wait and see.
